title: 1 Peter Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 1 Peter with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 5 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the epistle of 1 Peter?
questions.correctAnswer: Peter
questions.explanation: The letter begins with Peter identifying himself as the author, an apostle of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: To which regions were the recipients of 1 Peter scattered?
options: Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia
questions.correctAnswer: Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia
questions.explanation: Peter addresses the letter to strangers scattered throughout these specific provinces.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter, by what means are believers begotten again unto a lively hope?
options: By the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead
questions.correctAnswer: By the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead
questions.explanation: Peter states that believers have a lively hope through Christ's resurrection.

questions.question: What kind of inheritance is reserved for believers according to 1 Peter?
options: Incorruptible, undefiled, and fadeth not away
questions.correctAnswer: Incorruptible, undefiled, and fadeth not away
questions.explanation: Believers' inheritance is described as imperishable and eternal.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the trial of your faith as described in 1 Peter 1?
options: To test and prove faith, bringing praise, honor, and glory at Jesus Christ's appearing
To make believers perfect in knowledge
To separate the wealthy from the poor
questions.correctAnswer: To test and prove faith, bringing praise, honor, and glory at Jesus Christ's appearing
questions.explanation: Trials refine believers' faith making it more precious than gold.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 1, how should believers conduct themselves since they are called by a holy God?
options: Be holy in all manner of conversation
Follow the customs of the world
questions.correctAnswer: Be holy in all manner of conversation
questions.explanation: Believers are commanded to live holy lives because God is holy.

questions.question: What were believers redeemed with, according to 1 Peter 1?
options: The precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot
questions.correctAnswer: The precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot
questions.explanation: Peter contrasts redemption by precious blood with corruptible things like silver and gold.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of ____________, by the word of God, which liveth and abideth for ever."
questions.correctAnswer: incorruptible
questions.explanation: Believers are born again by the incorruptible seed, that is, the enduring word of God.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 2, believers are described as what kind of stones?
questions.correctAnswer: Living stones
questions.explanation: Believers are likened to living stones being built up as a spiritual house.

questions.question: Who is described as the 'chief corner stone' in 1 Peter?
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Jesus is described as the chief corner stone, chosen and precious.

questions.question: What identity is given to believers in 1 Peter 2:9?
options: A chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people
questions.correctAnswer: A chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people
questions.explanation: Believers are called to show forth the praises of God who called them out of darkness.

questions.question: What are believers exhorted to do with regard to fleshly lusts in 1 Peter 2?
options: Abstain from them, as they war against the soul
questions.correctAnswer: Abstain from them, as they war against the soul
questions.explanation: Peter urges believers to live as strangers and pilgrims abstaining from fleshly lusts.

questions.question: How should Christians behave among the Gentiles according to 1 Peter 2:12?
options: With honest conversation, so their good works glorify God
questions.correctAnswer: With honest conversation, so their good works glorify God
questions.explanation: Believers should live honorable lives to silence the ignorance of foolish men.

questions.question: What is the will of God regarding submission to human authorities, according to 1 Peter 2?
options: To submit with well doing so as to silence foolish men
questions.correctAnswer: To submit with well doing so as to silence foolish men
questions.explanation: Peter instructs submission to kings and governors for the Lord's sake, doing good.

questions.question: Complete the verse: "For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should _______ his steps."
questions.correctAnswer: follow
questions.explanation: Believers are to follow Christ's example of suffering.

questions.question: How did Jesus respond when He was reviled, according to 1 Peter?
options: He committed Himself to God who judges righteously
questions.correctAnswer: He committed Himself to God who judges righteously
questions.explanation: Jesus did not retaliate or threaten but trusted God's righteous judgment.

questions.question: What did Jesus bear in His own body on the tree, according to 1 Peter 2?
questions.correctAnswer: Our sins
questions.explanation: Christ bore our sins on the cross so we might live unto righteousness.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Peter describes believers as returned to the Shepherd and Bishop of their souls.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: Believers are likened to sheep who have returned to their Shepherd.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 3, how are wives instructed to win their unbelieving husbands?
options: By their chaste conversation coupled with fear
questions.correctAnswer: By their chaste conversation coupled with fear
questions.explanation: Wives are to win unbelieving husbands by their behavior, not words.

questions.question: What kind of adorning is recommended for women in 1 Peter 3?
options: The ornament of a meek and quiet spirit
questions.correctAnswer: The ornament of a meek and quiet spirit
questions.explanation: True beauty is found in a gentle and quiet spirit valued by God.

questions.question: Which Old Testament woman is referenced as an example of obedience to her husband in 1 Peter?
questions.correctAnswer: Sarah
questions.explanation: Sarah called Abraham lord and is cited as an example for wives.

questions.question: How should husbands treat their wives, according to 1 Peter 3?
options: According to knowledge, giving honor as the weaker vessel
questions.correctAnswer: According to knowledge, giving honor as the weaker vessel
questions.explanation: Husbands are to honor their wives and be considerate of their nature.

questions.question: True or False: Believers are instructed to not render evil for evil but to bless instead.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: Contrary to retaliation, believers are called to respond with blessings.

questions.question: What will happen to those who desire to love life and see good days, according to 1 Peter?
options: They should speak no guile and eschew evil
questions.correctAnswer: They should speak no guile and eschew evil
questions.explanation: Living righteously is connected with a blessed life.

questions.question: True or False: The eyes of the Lord are over the evil and His ears are open to their prayers.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: The Lord's eyes are over the righteous and His ears open to their prayers, but His face is against evildoers.

questions.question: What is said about Christ’s suffering for sins in 1 Peter 3?
options: Christ suffered many times for many sins
Christ suffered once for sins, the just for the unjust
questions.correctAnswer: Christ suffered once for sins, the just for the unjust
questions.explanation: Christ's suffering was a singular, atoning event for sin.

questions.question: Who did Christ preach unto, according to 1 Peter 3?
questions.correctAnswer: The spirits in prison
questions.explanation: Peter writes that Christ preached to spirits imprisoned, referring to those disobedient in Noah's days.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "The like figure whereunto even __________ doth also now save us."
questions.correctAnswer: baptism
questions.explanation: Baptism is described as a saving figure, not the removal of physical filth but a good conscience toward God.

questions.question: Where is Jesus now, according to 1 Peter 3?
options: In heaven, on the right hand of God
questions.correctAnswer: In heaven, on the right hand of God
questions.explanation: Christ ascended and is seated at God's right hand with all powers subject to Him.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4, how should believers arm themselves?
options: With the same mind as Christ who suffered in the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: With the same mind as Christ who suffered in the flesh
questions.explanation: Believers are encouraged to adopt Christ’s mindset in suffering and cease from sin.

questions.question: What was the past life of believers described as in 1 Peter 4?
options: A time to have wrought the will of the Gentiles in lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries
A time of peace and rest
questions.correctAnswer: A time to have wrought the will of the Gentiles in lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries
questions.explanation: The past life is described as sinful and worldly before conversion.

questions.question: True or False: Believers should think it strange concerning the fiery trial which is to try them.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: Peter encourages believers not to be surprised by trials but to rejoice as partakers of Christ's sufferings.

questions.question: What should believers have among themselves, as stated in 1 Peter 4?
questions.correctAnswer: Fervent charity
questions.explanation: Love is emphasized as covering a multitude of sins.

questions.question: How are believers to use their gifts, according to 1 Peter 4?
options: To minister one to another as good stewards of God's manifold grace
questions.correctAnswer: To minister one to another as good stewards of God's manifold grace
questions.explanation: Gifts are to be used for mutual service in humility and grace.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "If any man speak, let him speak as the __________ of God; if any man minister, let him do it as of the ability which God giveth."
questions.correctAnswer: oracles
questions.explanation: Believers should speak as oracles (divine messages) of God.

questions.question: What is said about suffering as a Christian in 1 Peter 4?
options: Let him glorify God on this behalf
It should be avoided at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: Let him glorify God on this behalf
questions.explanation: Suffering for Christ is honorable and should be glorified.

questions.question: True or False: Judgment begins at the house of God, according to 1 Peter 4.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: Peter explains that God's judgment starts with His own people.

questions.question: What is the attitude believers are told to have toward prayer in 1 Peter 4?
options: Be sober and watch unto prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Be sober and watch unto prayer
questions.explanation: Believers are urged to be alert and earnest in prayer.

questions.question: True or False: Peter encourages believers to use their liberty as a cloak for maliciousness.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: Believers are instructed not to misuse liberty but to serve God sincerely.

questions.question: What kind of spirit rests on believers who are reproached for the name of Christ, according to 1 Peter?
options: Spirit of glory and of God
questions.correctAnswer: Spirit of glory and of God
questions.explanation: Believers are blessed because God's Spirit rests upon them.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Peter describes the believers’ conversation as being honest among the Gentiles.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: Believers are exhorted to have honest conduct before non-believers.

questions.question: In 1 Peter, who judges without respect of persons according to every man's work?
questions.correctAnswer: The Father
questions.explanation: God the Father judges impartially based on works.

questions.question: True or False: The prophets prophesied not for themselves but for us, as they ministered the things now reported.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: Peter states that prophets foresaw the grace coming to believers.

questions.question: Complete the verse: "For all flesh is as grass, and all the glory of man as the flower of grass. The grass withereth, and the flower thereof _______ away."
questions.correctAnswer: falleth
questions.explanation: This verse reminds believers of the transience of human life and glory.
